alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 1:31PM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Periods of snow, along with a prolonged period of extremely dangerous wind chills. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Wind chills as low as 40 degrees below zero likely. * WHERE...East central Wyoming into the northern Nebraska Panhandle including Douglas, Lusk, Harrison, and Chadron. * WHEN...Winter Weather Advisory in effect until 11 AM MST Tuesday. Wind Chill Warning in effect from 5 PM MST this evening until 11 AM MST Thursday February 24th. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow covered roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Dangerously low wind chills could lead to frostbite on exposed skin in 5 minutes or less. Hypothermia can develop quickly if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County
